newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia urges state firms to be enterpreneurs.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia urges state firms to be enterpreneurs.

text.p: Indonesian Finance Minister Mar'ie Muhammad urged state-owned companies on Tuesday to follow the lead of private firms and act as entrepreneurs.
"The government itself needs to behave as an entrepreneur, so do state-owned companies," Mar'ie told a meeting attended by officials of state firms.

"Competition has increased. It is important to focus on our customers. We must be customer-oriented at all costs," he added. "There is a need to redefine the position and the role of state-owned companies. If I may advise, it is the same as the role of private companies."
Mar'ie said state-owned companies should respond swiftly to customers' needs.
The minister has said the number of state-owned firms had fallen to 178 last year from 183 in 1993.
